intro: Metrosideros vera, commonly known as the Tahitian redwood, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, and it produces small, round fruits containing a single seed. Metrosideros vera is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found in humid, tropical climates.
